headline: Big Tech and Pharma Earnings: What to Watch This Week
summary: Earnings season marches on. Two more Magnificent Seven tech companies—Alphabet and Amazon—will report, following on the heels of disappointing results from Microsoft that helped send software stocks tumbling last week.

headline: Boston Scientific announces results for fourth quarter and full year 2025
summary: Boston Scientific Corporation (NYSE: BSX) generated net sales of $5.286 billion during the fourth quarter of 2025, growing 15.9 percent on a reported basis, 14.3 percent on an operational1 basis and 12.7 percent on an organic2 basis, all compared to the prior year period. The company reported GAAP net income attributable to Boston Scientific common stockholders of $672 million or $0.45 per share (EPS), compared to $566 million or $0.38 per share a year ago, and achieved adjusted3 EPS of $0.80 fo

headline: Boston Scientific: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 10 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 78 cents per share. The medical device manufacturer posted revenue of $5.29 billion in the period, which also topped Street forecasts. Nine analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $5.27 billion.

content.title: Boston Scientific: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The average estimate of 10 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 78 cents per share. The medical device manufacturer posted revenue of $5.29 billion in the period, which also topped Street forecasts. Nine analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $5.27 billion.

headline: Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) Reports Q4 CY2025 In Line With Expectations
summary: Medical device company Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 15.9% year on year to $5.29 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $5.19 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.80 per share was 2.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) Reports Q4 CY2025 In Line With Expectations
content.summary: Medical device company Boston Scientific (NYSE:BSX) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 15.9% year on year to $5.29 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $5.19 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.80 per share was 2.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Boston Scientific shares slide on cautious 2026 revenue forecast
summary: Feb 4 () - Boston Scientific Corp forecast modest 2026 revenue growth and profit just ​below Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, ‌overshadowing a strong fourth-quarter performance and sending its shares down ‌more than 11% in premarket trading. The medical-device maker projected 2026 adjusted earnings per share of $3.

content.title: Boston Scientific shares slide on cautious 2026 revenue forecast
content.summary: Feb 4 () - Boston Scientific Corp forecast modest 2026 revenue growth and profit just ​below Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, ‌overshadowing a strong fourth-quarter performance and sending its shares down ‌more than 11% in premarket trading. The medical-device maker projected 2026 adjusted earnings per share of $3.

headline: Boston Scientific (BSX) Beats Q4 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Boston Scientific (BSX) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +2.96% and +0.39%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Stock Index Futures Steady After Tech-Led Selloff, U.S. ADP Jobs Report and Alphabet Earnings in Focus
summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are up +0.11%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are up +0.01% this morning, steadying after yesterday’s tech-led selloff, while investors await the U.S. ADP employment report and a slew of corporate earnings reports, with a particular focus on results from “Magnificent Seven” member Alphabet.

content.title: Stock Index Futures Steady After Tech-Led Selloff, U.S. ADP Jobs Report and Alphabet Earnings in Focus

headline: Texas Instruments to buy Silicon Labs, Enphase stock surges 40%
summary: Market Catalysts Host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Texas Instruments (TXN) purchasing Silicon Laboratories (SLAB) in a deal valued at $7.5 billion, Enphase Energy (ENPH) surging by over 40% on its fourth quarter earnings results, and Boston Scientific (BSX) shares dropping on its weak forecast. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Texas Instruments to buy Silicon Labs, Enphase stock surges 40%

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
